page.title: 04HOUSING IN SALTBURN
page.content: Saltburn's housing shows a mixture of styles since its growth from a hamlet in the 1860's. The terraced housing in the Jewel Streets remain in good condition. Many of the largest houses have been converted into flats. Others are still used as Guest Houses. The railway divides old Saltburn from later construction in the late 19th and early 20th Century. Most is terraced but includes old town housing (Glenside) extending into a small post war private estate. The other housing is found along and off Marske Road. To the north an inter-war estate can be found, to the south a post war private development (Wilton Bank) and a Council estate (Woodrow Avenue). On the Guisborough Road there is the Hob Hill Private estate. Approx. 70% of housing is owner occupied, 13% council housing and 13% rented accommodation.
